Package net.minestom.server.network

Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
net.minestom.server.network.ConnectionManager
public final class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
Manages the connected clients.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer​(@NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
      Gets the Player linked to a PlayerConnection.
      Parameters:
      connection - the player connection
      Returns:
      the player linked to the connection

    • getOnlinePlayers

      @NotNull public java.util.Collection<Player> getOnlinePlayers()
      Gets all online players.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable collection containing all the online players

    • getPlayer

      @Nullable public Player getPlayer​(@NotNull java.lang.String username)
      Gets the first player which validate String.equalsIgnoreCase(String).

      This can cause issue if two or more players have the same username.

      Parameters:
      username - the player username (ignoreCase)
      Returns:
      the first player who validate the username condition, null if none was found

    • getPlayer

      @Nullable public Player getPlayer​(@NotNull java.util.UUID uuid)
      Gets the first player which validate UUID.equals(Object).

      This can cause issue if two or more players have the same UUID.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the player UUID
      Returns:
      the first player who validate the UUID condition, null if none was found

    • broadcastMessage

      public void broadcastMessage​(@NotNull JsonMessage jsonMessage, @Nullable PlayerValidator condition)
      Sends a JsonMessage to all online players who validate the condition condition.
      Parameters:
      jsonMessage - the message to send, probably a ColoredText or RichMessage
      condition - the condition to receive the message

    • broadcastMessage

      public void broadcastMessage​(@NotNull JsonMessage jsonMessage)
      Sends a JsonMessage to all online players.
      Parameters:
      jsonMessage - the message to send, probably a ColoredText or RichMessage

    • getReceivePacketConsumers

      Gets all the listeners which are called for each packet received.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of packet's consumers

      Adds a consumer to call once a packet is received.
      Parameters:
      packetConsumer - the packet consumer

    • getSendPacketConsumers

      @NotNull public java.util.List<PacketConsumer<ServerPacket>> getSendPacketConsumers()
      Gets all the listeners which are called for each packet sent.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of packet's consumers

    • onPacketSend

      public void onPacketSend​(@NotNull PacketConsumer<ServerPacket> packetConsumer)
      Adds a consumer to call once a packet is sent.

      Be aware that it is possible for the same packet instance to be used multiple time, changing the object fields could lead to issues. (consider canceling the packet instead and send your own)

      Parameters:
      packetConsumer - the packet consumer

    • setUuidProvider

      public void setUuidProvider​(@Nullable UuidProvider uuidProvider)
      Changes how UUID are attributed to players.

      Shouldn't be override if already defined.

      Be aware that it is possible for an UUID provider to be ignored, for example in the case of a proxy (eg: velocity).

      Parameters:
      uuidProvider - the new player connection uuid provider, setting it to null would apply a random UUID for each player connection
      See Also:
      getPlayerConnectionUuid(PlayerConnection, String)

    • getPlayerConnectionUuid

      @NotNull public java.util.UUID getPlayerConnectionUuid​(@NotNull PlayerConnection playerConnection, @NotNull java.lang.String username)
      Computes the UUID of the specified connection. Used in LoginStartPacket in order to give the player the right UUID.
      Parameters:
      playerConnection - the player connection
      username - the username given by the connection
      Returns:
      the uuid based on playerConnection return a random UUID if no UUID provider is defined see setUuidProvider(UuidProvider)

    • setPlayerProvider

      public void setPlayerProvider​(@Nullable PlayerProvider playerProvider)
      Changes the Player provider, to change which object to link to him.
      Parameters:
      playerProvider - the new PlayerProvider, can be set to null to apply the default provider

    • getPlayerProvider

      @NotNull public PlayerProvider getPlayerProvider()
      Retrieves the current PlayerProvider, can be the default one if none is defined.
      Returns:
      the current PlayerProvider

    • getPlayerInitializations

      @NotNull public java.util.List<java.util.function.Consumer<Player>> getPlayerInitializations()
      Those are all the consumers called when a new Player join.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list containing all the Player initialization consumer

    • addPlayerInitialization

      public void addPlayerInitialization​(@NotNull java.util.function.Consumer<Player> playerInitialization)
      Adds a new player initialization consumer. Those are called when a Player join, mainly to add event callbacks to the player.

      This callback should be exclusively used to add event listeners since it is called directly after a player join (before any chunk is sent) and the client behavior can therefore be unpredictable. You can add your "init" code in PlayerLoginEvent or even PlayerPreLoginEvent.

      Parameters:
      playerInitialization - the Player initialization consumer

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer​(@NotNull Player player)
      Adds a new Player in the players list. Is currently used at LoginStartPacket.process(PlayerConnection) and in FakePlayer.initPlayer(UUID, String, Consumer).
      Parameters:
      player - the player to add

    • createPlayer

      @NotNull public Player createPlayer​(@NotNull java.util.UUID uuid, @NotNull java.lang.String username, @NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
      Creates a Player object and register it.
      Parameters:
      uuid - the new player uuid
      username - the new player username
      connection - the new player connection
      Returns:
      the newly created player object

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(@NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
      Removes a Player from the players list.

      Used during disconnection, you shouldn't have to do it manually.

      Parameters:
      connection - the player connection
      See Also:
      to properly disconnect a player

    • startPlayState

      @NotNull public Player startPlayState​(@NotNull PlayerConnection connection, @NotNull java.util.UUID uuid, @NotNull java.lang.String username)
      Sends a LoginSuccessPacket and change the connection state to ConnectionState.PLAY.
      Parameters:
      connection - the player connection
      uuid - the uuid of the player
      username - the username of the player
      Returns:
      the newly created player object
